GalleryContent.Body: Sometimes numerical manipulation isn’t the right approach. Now you can manually push-and-pull Point geometry when navigating in the background 3D preview.

When you have long running portions of your graph, or don’t want to export data to other applications, or want to debug some logic, don’t unplug your nodes. Now you can suspend execution of specified nodes in the graph by using Freeze in the right-click contextual menu.
Only look at the node libraries you want to with new filtering tools. See more options at once by using a compact view, or get more information with the detail view.
Huge improvements to the speed and reliability of placing large numbers of adaptive components.

- Zoom Re-Center: Select a node, then zoom and center your orbit in the 3D preview - CTRL + Drag: Copy/Paste nodes in a familiar way - Add comments to custom node inputs and full default states for complex data types - More forgiving DesignScript Syntax: Users can now write instance methods as static methods
